title: Utah County
summary: Blockchain ledger for county budget and health department spend; citizen-facing transparency.
problem: County budgeting lacked unified, real-time visibility for officials and the public.
intervention: Immutable ledger with role-based approvals tied to program budgets and public dashboards.

title: Ghana
summary: Anchoring national records to blockchain to prevent tampering and improve trust.
problem: Centralized registries were vulnerable to alteration and inconsistent provenance.
intervention: Blockchain-backed registry with audit trail and identity-bound write permissions.
outcomes: Improved confidence for agencies and citizens

title: U.S. Department of Defense
summary: Traceability from appropriations to program activities; smart contracts for eligibility and drawdowns.
problem: Limited line-of-sight across multi-year grants and subcontracting created fraud and leakage risk.
intervention: Program-level smart contracts enforcing eligibility, milestones, and controlled disbursements.
outcomes: Audit-ready lineage from budget to beneficiary

title: Inter-agency Blockchain Initiative
summary: Shared ledger across agencies for coordinated funding and oversight.
problem: Siloed financial systems blocked cross-agency reconciliation and oversight.
intervention: Consortium chain linking sub-ledgers with common data standards and APIs.
outcomes: Unified view of obligations and outlays

title: UN World Food Programme
summary: Aid disbursement with identity verification to reduce leakage and duplication.
problem: Aid programs faced beneficiary duplication and limited traceability of entitlements.
intervention: Blockchain wallets linked to verified identities for entitlements and delivery confirmation.
outcomes: Faster settlement and reporting to donors

title: U.S. Department of Energy
summary: Grant distribution and asset tracking with immutable records.
problem: Fragmented tracking of funded projects and assets across labs and partners.
intervention: Blockchain-backed grant lifecycle with asset tokenization and milestone proofs.
outcomes: Clear chain of custody for funded assets

title: Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)
summary: Mission-aligned blockchain oversight to cap fraud/waste across federal spending.
problem: National mandate to reduce fraud lacked unified, real-time oversight tooling.
intervention: Blockchain oversight platform measuring obligations vs. appropriations with alerts.
outcomes: Policy enforcement tied to spending events

title: U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID)
summary: Transparent aid flows and partner accountability on a shared ledger.
problem: Complex international aid flows created opacity and audit lag.
intervention: Consortium blockchain for grants with partner attestations and AI anomaly detection.

title: UN Joint Staff Pension Fund
summary: Decentralized identity to reduce beneficiary fraud and accelerate verification.
problem: Manual beneficiary verification slowed payouts and was vulnerable to identity fraud.
intervention: Self-sovereign identity with verifiable credentials for pension beneficiaries and approvers.

title: U.S. Health & Human Services
summary: End-to-end contract and supply-chain tracking with auditable budget tie-in.
problem: Opaque procurement chain from budget to delivery limited oversight.
intervention: Blockchain supply-chain with budget-linked smart contracts and milestone attestations.

title: USAF DiBaT
summary: Digital Blockchain Budget Accountability and Tracking for Air Force programs.
problem: Need for auditable linkage between program budgets and vendor performance.
intervention: Program-level ledger with budget locks, milestone proofs, and vendor credentialing.
